Time-frame unclear, but possibly was while he was at St. Stanislaus in Ambridge, where he worked 12/53-6/57. He allegedly made the girl dress provocatively, gave her wine, and forced her to perform oral sex on him. The abuse allegedly occurred several times a week. Wichmanowski died in 1977. Claims included in Diocese's 9/07 $1.25 mil settlement as to 32 plaintiffs alleging abuse by 17 priests. Named in 8/14/18 PA Grand Jury Report.
Source/Assignments: Source:Pittsburgh Post-Gazette  04.29.04; Post-Gazette  09.18.07; PA Grand Jury Report Profile  08.14.18Assignments:PA Grand Jury Report Profile  08.14.18

Notes: Worked in parishes in St. Charles County, and in several rural parishes in Advance, Charleston (later part of Springfield-Cape Girardeau diocese) and Arcadia. Archbishop Carlson announced 3/16/11 that several individuals (at least 5) had come forward in recent years to accuse Wieberg of abuse almost 50 years prior. Wieberg died in 1963. One man, now 80, said he was abused in 1940 at age 9. Reports were found credible by archdiocesan review board. On the archdiocese's list 7/26/19. On Springfield-Cape Girardeau list updated 4/1/19.  It notes abuse 1942-45 reported in 2004 and 2018.
Source/Assignments: Source:St Louis Review  03.16.11; Joplin Independent  03.21.11; St Louis Post Dispatch  03.21.11; KMOV  03.22.11; KMOX  03.22.11; News-Leader  03.22.11; Berger's Beat  11.01.11; Diocese of Springfield-Cape Girardeau List  04.01.19; Archdiocese of St Louis List  07.26.19

Notes: Removed from ministry in 1992. A man filed civil suit same year which alleged that Wild fondled him in the rectory at St. Bernard's Church in Oriska in 1966. Two more men had filed suits by 11/94. All three suits settled in 12/94. Both 1993 and 2002 Catholic Directories refer to Wild as "retired."  Died 10/26/08. Included on the diocese's list 1/2/20. Allegations substantiated.
Source/Assignments: Source:Minot Daily News  09.25.92; Bismark Tribune  08.29.93; Bismark Tribune  11.07.94; Bismark Tribune  01.01.95; Boulger Funeral Home website  10.26.08

Notes: Accused in 1999 of sexually abusing a nun, age 27, in the Winnipeg archdiocese 1978-79. Wilfort was then superior of the order's Western Canada Province. Abuse allegedly included digital penetration and was represented as therapeutic. Complainant had been recruited from the Manchester NH diocese during a retreat by Wilfort. The Vatican investigated the charges in 2000. Complainant filed suit in 2002, but when she died in 2004, the suit was dismissed. Other victims are alleged, ages unspecified.
Source/Assignments: Source:Dalmyn 4.6.04; Union Leader 6.2.03; Union Leader 8.2.03; McDonald Affidavit  05.10.02; McDonald Affidavit  05.30.02; Globe and Mail  06.25.02

Notes: Named publicly as accused by the Paulist order on its list 3/8/19. It notes an allegation reported in 2017 of abuse in Minneapolis in 1964, and that the report was part of the MN Child Victims Act. Wilhelm left the Paulists 8/20/75 and died 7/7/99.
Source/Assignments: Source:Paulist Fathers List  03.08.19Assignments:Paulist Fathers List  03.08.19

Notes: Accused in 2009 of a 5-year affair in IL with a woman beginning in the early 1980s. Another woman came forward during that time to allege a long relationship with him when she was in high school. Order sent him to Paraclete facility for treatment for 7 months. The first woman gave birth to his son after his return. She received support from order over the years, and made matter public in 10/09 because the 22-year-old son had terminal cancer and she also had cancer. Diocese placed WIllenborg on leave pending investigation. Son died 12/09. On the Springfield-Cape Girardeau diocese's list updated 4/1/19.
Source/Assignments: Source:NY Times  10.15.09; Duluth News Tribune  10.16.09; Associated Press  10.17.09; Duluth News Tribune  10.17.09; NY Times  10.17.09; River Front Times  10.19.09; KTVI  10.20.09; KSDK  10.23.09; St Louis Post-Dispatch  10.23.09; Herald-Whig  11.04.09; NY Times  11.29.09; Bona Venture  12.07.09; The Times (UK)  04.17.10; Quincy News  07.01.10; Berger's Beat  07.29.10; Response by Diocese of Springfield  08.05.10; State Journal-Register  08.06.10; Wisconsin Public Radio  12.21.15; SNAP  12.31.15; WIVB  12.19.18; Diocese of Springfield-Cape Girardeau List  04.01.19Assignments:; BA.org Assignment Record

Notes: Willett and 2 other priests accused of abuse in 1960s. Alleged victim settled with Diocese in 1999 for $41K. In 2003 she committed suicide. Family returned settlement and filed suit on her behalf, saying she didn't have capacity to enter into settlement, She had been hospitalized several times. Diocese said she was 18 and relationship was consentual.  He died 11/6/01.
Source/Assignments: Source:Paducah Sun  11.07.01; Courier-Journal  11.07.03; Courier-Journal  11.08.03; Messinger-Inquirer  07.19.06

Notes: Named publicly as accused on the diocese's list 1/17/19. Noted to have a single substantiated allegation against him of abuse, occurring in 1952, reported after his death. Williams died in 1983.
Source/Assignments: Source:Diocese of Green Bay List  01.17.19; Diocese of Green Bay List: Williams  01.17.19Assignments:Diocese of Green Bay List: Williams 01.17.19

Notes: Tommie Pierick and his priest uncle told Bishop Dingman in 1978 of abuse in late 1960s starting when boy was 12. Threats and gifts used; farmhouse a common venue. Diocese admits no record of 2 complaints. W removed 1981. T died by suicide 1985; W sent for treatment again in same year. T's sister went to the diocese 1993. She went public 2002; other victims then surfaced. Diocese asked for defrocking 9/19/03. T's brother sued 2/25/04. W died 9/26/04. Civil suit filed 2006; settled 2007. On diocese's list 4/4/19. It notes 25 allegations of abuse of boys, occurring late 1950s to the mid 1980s. On San Antonio diocese's list 1/31/19. Lived in diocese 1982-84. Investigated 1984 by San Antonio police for sex assault of adult male, sent to treatment in NM. Report in 2018 of abuse of boy 1983 or 1984.
Source/Assignments: Source:Des Moines Register  05.12.02; Des Moines Register  05.16.02; Des Moines Register  05.30.03; Channel 4000  09.19.03; Des Moines Register  09.20.03; Des Moines Register  02.26.04; Des Moines Register  10.03.04; Des Moines Register  01.18.06; Des Moines Register  08.24.07; Des Moines Register  07.01.14; Archdiocese of San Antonio List  01.31.19; Diocese of Des Moines List  04.04.19Assignments:Des Moines Register 9.20.03

Notes: Named publicly as accused by the diocese on its list 2/22/19. One allegation noted, deemed credible by the St. Meinrad Archabbey Review Board. Woerdeman was laicized in 1975 and died in 2005.
Source/Assignments: Source:Diocese of Evansville List  02.22.19; WFIE TV  02.25.19Assignments:Diocese of Evansville List  02.22.19

Notes: Named publicly as accused in the CO A.G. report 10/22/19. The archdiocese received an allegation in 3/19 that Woerth sexually abused a male high school student in 1971, '72 and '73, while assigned to Holy Trinity parish in Colorado Springs and St. Mary's High School. Woerth denied the allegation. The archdiocese removed his faculties. He had retired in 2008 and moved out of state.
Source/Assignments: Source:CO Attorney General Special Masters Report  10.22.19; Denver Post  11.04.19Assignments:Anderson Ad Book 11.13.19

Notes: Placed on Administrative Leave 5/10 after complaint that Wolski sexually abused a 15- to 17-year-old boy 1968 -1970. Much of the abuse was said to have occurred at St. Barnabas in Depew, and at Wolski's cottage in Angola. Wolski had been a member of Diocesan Review Board and Children's Hospital chaplain. He retired in 2012. Allegations substantiated, per diocese in 12/18. On diocese's list 1/19.
Source/Assignments: Source:WIVB  05.31.18; WKBW  05.31.18; WKBW  05.31.18; WKBW  12.14.18; Buffalo News  01.07.19; WGRZ TV  01.07.19

Notes: Wood was added as a defendant in existing litigation 10/07. He is accused of abuse in Chevak, AK. He served in rural Alaska for approximately 12 yrs. Claims included in 11/07 settlement with Jesuits.  One pending claim shown in bankruptcy reorganization documents for Fairbanks Diocese 1/25/10. Wood died 03/11/97.
Source/Assignments: Source:Fairbanks News-Miner  11.03.07; Anchorage Daily News  11.20.07; Good Jesuit, Bad Jesuit  11.12.09; Excerpt from Bankruptcy Reorganization Documents for Fairbanks Diocese  01.25.10Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

Notes: Wood was removed from his parish assignment in August 2003. He wrote in the parish bulletin that his removal was due to an alleged incident 16 years prior. Wood had  previously served as parochial vicar at another parish for 13 years before being transferred in 2001. No information provided as to victims or type of abuse. Included in 3/20/18 diocesan list as removed, retired, or having left ministry after allegations of sexual abuse of a minor.
Source/Assignments: Source:Buffalo News  09.10.03; Buffalo News  09.11.03; Buffalo News  09.14.03; Buffalo News  02.28.18; Buffalo News  03.20.18; Buffalo Stories  03.20.18; Diocese of Buffalo  03.20.18; Buffalo News  03.21.18Assignments:Jeff Anderson & Associates Assignment History

Notes: Named publicly as accused by the Jesuits West Province on its list 12/7/18. It notes a report in 2002 of the sexual abuse of a minor the same year. Assigned 2000-2002 to Verbum Dei High School in Los Angeles. Moved to Sacred Heart Jesuit Center in Los Gatos 2002-2004, to Colombiere House in Los Angeles 2004-2008, then back to the Jesuit Center in Los Gatos 2008-2014. He died 6/29/14.
Source/Assignments: Source:Jesuits West Province List  12.07.18Assignments:Jesuits West Province List  12.07.18

Notes: Sued 2002 by a man alleging sexual abuse by Woulfe and Rev. William A. Christensen at Chaminade Prep in St. Louis, when the boy was age 15-17. On appeal, the MO Supreme Court ruled that repressed memories were admissible and the suit was not time-barred.  New accusations received 9/11 and confirmed by letters to school alumni in 2012. Woulfe was at school for 9 years before leaving the Order in 1977. He died in 2005. New suit filed by one man 4/9/14 alleges abuse at Chaminade Prep in approximately 1970. Another suit filed 11/15 accused Woulfe of repeated sex abuse of Chaminade student 1968-71, including masturbation and oral sex during "college counseling" meetings.
Source/Assignments: Source:St Louis Post Dispatch  06.10.02; St Louis Daily Record  06.02.05; Missouri Lawyers Weekly  06.06.05; Kansas City Star (AP)  09.08.05; Missouri  Supreme Court  Ruling  06.13.06; St Louis Post-Dispatch  09.06.07; Connecticut Post  12.08.09; SNAP Statement  03.22.11; Fox 2  02.07.12; KMOX  02.07.12; KSDK  02.07.12; KSDK  02.07.12; SNAP Statement  02.07.12; St Louis Post-Dispatch  02.07.12; The Patch  02.07.12; The Patch  02.07.12; The Republic  02.07.12; KSDK  02.08.12; KMOX  02.14.12; Berger's Beat  04.09.14; SNAP Statement  04.09.14; St Louis Post-Dispatch  04.09.14; Riverfront Times  11.05.15; St Louis Post-Dispatch  11.05.15; St Louis Post-Dispatch  12.09.15; St Louis Post-Dispatch  05.28.19

Notes: Diocese announced 12/07 that it had recently received a credible allegation against Wyrsch involving abuse of a minor about 40 years prior. Worked in Poplar Bluff and Joplin before taking leaving in 1969. Returned as a chaplain at SW Missouri State College in 1970. Left active ministry again in 1973, was laicized in 1989, and died in 1997. On the diocese's list 11/19/18.
Source/Assignments: Source:Springfield News-Leader  12.30.07; Springfield News-Leader  01.01.08; Joplin Globe  05.01.17; Diocese of Springfield-Cape Girardeau List  11.19.18Assignments:KY3.com 12.28.07

Notes: Removed 2002 as "retired." Accused of abuse of teenage girls in 1960s.  Parents were complaining of his behavior as early as 1973. Named in civil suit in 2004. In 2005 the Vatican upheld Cardinal Maida's decision to permanently remove him from pastoral duties. Died of heart attack 1/07.
Source/Assignments: Source:Archdiocese of Detroit Status Report 10.09; Detroit Free Press 1.3.07; Detroit Free Press  06.28.02; Detroit News  06.28.02; Arch. of Detroit News Release  06.30.02; USA Today  11.11.02; Associated Press  05.27.05

Notes: A woman notified the diocese in 5/07 that Zalewski "hugged her to his body" at St. Joseph church in Lincoln in 1956, when she was approximately age 12. He died in 1976.
Source/Assignments: Source:NH AG Audit Records  03.26.09; Diocese of Manchester List  07.31.19Assignments:Diocese of Manchester List  07.31.19

Notes: Per a 7/02 article, Zaunbrecher, who died in 1996, is listed as having molested children while serving as a priest. He spent time away from his ministry on "special assignment."  In 1985-95, he was assigned to the Church of the Little Flower in Mobile, AL He returned to Lafayette in 1995. On Lafayette diocese's list in 4/19. It notes he retired in 1995.
Source/Assignments: Source:FindAGrave  06.19.96; The Advocate  06.21.96; The TImes Acadiana  07.17.02; Diocese of Lafayette List  04.12.19Assignments:The Advocate 6.21.96

Notes: Named publicly as accused on the diocese's list 12/3/18. Ordained for Syracuse diocese. Worked in Diocese of Venice FL 10/88--06. Incardinated into Venice diocese 1/92. Per obit, Zedar retired 9/8/06. Died 2/8/09.
Source/Assignments: Source:Diocese of Syracuse List  12.03.18; Tributes website accessed  01.02.19

Notes: First named publicly as accused on archdiocese's list 10/12/18. Noted to have one victim, abuse allegedly occurring 1955-57. Ziemer died 4/26/80. Allegations reported after his death.
Source/Assignments: Source:Archdiocese of Indianapolis list  10.12.18; Indianapolis Star  10.12.18; Batesville Herald Tribune  10.14.18

Notes: In 9/08 the diocese announced a credible allegation that ZImmerer abused a boy, age 11, while was assigned to Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary in Decatur in 1978. Zimmerer died in 1983 at age 74. As of 9/15, two more men had come forward with credible allegations of abuse at the same church. Also worked in AR, MI, WI. Name included on Little Rock's 9/10/18 list (mistakenly as Francis 'Zimmer'). On the Springfield-Cape Girardeau diocese's list updated 4/1/19.
Source/Assignments: Source:Ft Worth Star-Telegram  09.08.08; DFW Catholic  09.09.08; North Texas Daily  09.09.08; Ft Worth Star-Telegram  09.15.08; Dallas Morning News  09.16.08; Diocese of Fort Worth List of Accused Priests accessed  01.01.12; Diocese of Little Rock list  09.10.18; Country Monks bio accessed  02.22.19; Diocese of Springfield-Cape Girardeau List  04.01.19Assignments:Diocese of Little Rock list 09.10.18; Country Monks bio accessed 02.22.19

Notes: Removed from ministry in 1993 after a man alleged physical and sexual abuse 1974-79 while Ziter was pastor of Our Lady Queen of Peace in Selma. Sued in 1994. Suit dismissed on SOL. Ziter founded the Boys and Girls Club in Slma. Assignments in AL included Queen of Peace in Selma, St. Philip Neri in Belle Fontaine, St. Elizabeth in Selma, and Our Lady of Lourdes in Mobile. Director of spiritual affairs at St. Michael's College in VT 1961-67 and worked in parishes in Swanton and Williston. Ziter died 7/7/2000. Included the Mobile archdiocese's list 12/6/18. Per the Edmundites' list 8/7/19, the allegation was substantiated.
Source/Assignments: Source:Mobile Register  03.07.95; Mobile Register  03.08.95; AL website  11.19.18; Archdiocese of Mobile List  12.06.18; Edmundite List  08.07.19; Seven Days  09.25.19

Notes: Parish assignments in Bridgeport, Emmaus, Willow Grove and Philadelphia. Involved in a Germantown summer camp. Music Director at Allentown Central Catholic High School, later at Reading Central Catholic High. Residing at St. Mary's parish in Kutztown.when he died 9/18/62. First named publicly as accused on Allentown's 8/19/18 list. Allegation received after his death.
Source/Assignments: Source:Jim Thorpe Times News Obituary  09.19.62; Diocese of Allentown list  08.19.18
